Description: Body and foot sherd of Attic red-figured pottery stemless (Castulo) cup; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of fight (lower half of nude warrior striding to right with sword in scabbard at side on sword belt, profile shield on left arm, spear held low in right hand); on the right, advanced foot of opponent; to the left, part of enclosed palmette and tendril handle complex; relief line throughout; reserved band; foot: outer edge, resting surface and underside reserved; inner face of ring foot glazed black; central black dot and circle on underside.
Curator's comments: The sherd nearly joins British Museum 1888,0601.602, to form profile of vessel. Note in interleaved BM Cat. Vases III (E134.5): the low foot of the kylix, with part of the palmette and lower part of another warrior, was found in 1900 and joined. Beazley (CVA Oxford I, 13, pl. 14, 24) suggests that this sherd belongs with Oxford G138.24.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E134.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0727) (Phase 1)
